Description: Ostraca, two fragments of the body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the interior is covered with a brown-black deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and (fragment a) faint traces of the beginnings of at least eight lines of Coptic text written in black ink and (fragment b) remains of four lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a list of vessels.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.119)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87627) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87627)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 137 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
